title: What are some great examples of philosophy in daily life that would make one want to study it seriously? - Quora

response.answer_text: Most of our day’s happiness/misery is NOT controlled by us. It depends on the external things rather than our own ability to control it. For a child, the happiness/misery lies is getting/losing a chocolate. For an adult, the happiness lies in the promotions, salary, beautiful_spouse, house, money. If we don’t get those when we expect, we become sad. For elderly, the happiness lies in getting attention/care from children. Elaborating … As an adult, we have went past our childhood. We are pretty sure that “chocolate” is not the source of happiness. It is the temporary illusion for the child who thinks that chocolate is all he needs to be happy. Hence, if the child gets too attached/addicted to chocolate, he ends up having bad teeth. Although, tasting it makes the child happy, but getting “attached/addicted” to it costs him. Let him try to get the chocolate, but if he fails, he should not keep crying about it. The sad part is as we grow, the “chocolate” gets replaced by something else, but in most of us, the desrire of getting it desperately, attaches us so much that we become slave of it, and lose control of our own happiness/misery. Hence, Philosophy teaches us how to be master of our own emotions, no matter what are the external conditions. It liberates us from all the things we try to cling to, depend on, attach to, in order to be happy. Therefore, rather than learning things the hard way, we can try to learn from scholars, who have put their ideas/experiences in the form of philosophy.
